intro: Alkanna graeca subsp. baeotica, commonly known as the Greek alkanna, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive red-brown, tubular roots that are used in traditional medicine. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers in late spring. The roots are harvested for their medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects.
